alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 6:58AM CDT until April 21 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. .An ice jam is likely affecting the river levels on Red Lake River at Crookston MN. An additional increase into major flood stage is possible as ice moves through the area. Fluctuations of several feet are possible. Uncertainty exists of rate of rise and fall as ice moves through, in addition to river levels into mid to late this week due to forecast chance for precipitation and cooler than average temperatures. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red Lake River at Crookston. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, MAJOR FLOOD STAGE. Ward Command Posts activated if advised by EOC Committee. Levee patrols begin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:35 AM CDT Monday the stage was 22.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:35 AM CDT Monday was 22.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to rise to a crest of near 23.0 feet this afternoon. There is uncertainty in exact crest due to ice jam. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
